honeywell.printer

Class ParametersEZ

  • java.lang.Object
    • honeywell.printer.Parameters
      • honeywell.printer.ParametersEZ

  • public class ParametersEZ
extends Parameters
    This class represents the general parameters that can be used to alter the printing characteristics when 'printing' to a DocumentEZ object. Printing characteristics are 'local' to each print command they are passed into. To have global settings the same parameters object can be passed into each write call to the Document object.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ParametersEZ.Alignment
      Alignment of the printing object
      static class  ParametersEZ.Rotation
      Amount to rotate the printing.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParametersEZ

        public ParametersEZ()

    • Method Detail

      • getRotate

        public ParametersEZ.Rotation getRotate()
        This is the number of degrees the printing will be rotated about the starting location in the counter-clockwise direction. The default value for this parameter is 0 degrees.
        Returns:
        The number of degrees the printing will be rotated counter-clockwise.
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • getAlignment

        public ParametersEZ.Alignment getAlignment()
        This is the horizontal alignment to use when writing the item. The options are:
        • Alignment.Left - Left aligned. This will write the item starting at the column specified in the write command.
        • Alignment.Center - Center aligned. This will write the item centered at the column specified in the write command.
        • Alignment.Right - Right aligned. This will write the item flush against the right side of the column specified in the write command.
        Returns:
        Alignment setting to use.

      • setFont

        public void setFont(java.lang.String fontName)
        The font name is a five character string that represents the name of the font, already loaded on the printer, that you wish to print with.
        Parameters:
        fontName - The five character font name or the empty string if the default font is to be used.

      • getIsBold

        public boolean getIsBold()
        Is printer going to print with bold text or not.
        Returns:
        true if bold text will be printed

      • setIsBold

        public void setIsBold(boolean isBold)
        Sets whether to print with bold text or not
        Parameters:
        isBold - set value to true if you want to print with bold text

      • setHorizontalMultiplier

        public void setHorizontalMultiplier(int multiplier)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        The horizontal multiplier property will cause the horizontal printing of the object to be scaled by that amount. So a value of two would cause a printing of the object to be double its original width. The default value for this parameter is 1 and the range of valid values is 1 to 255.
        Parameters:
        multiplier - Factor by which to scale the printing horizontally.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the parameter values are not in the valid range.

      • setVerticalMultiplier

        public void setVerticalMultiplier(int multiplier)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        The vertical multiplier property will cause the vertical printing of the object to be scaled by that amount. So a value of two would cause a printing of the object to be double its original hieght. The default value for this parameter is 1 and the range of valid values is 1 to 255.
        Parameters:
        multiplier - Factor by which to scale the printing vertically.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the parameter values are not in the valid range.

      • setRotate

        public void setRotate(ParametersEZ.Rotation rotationAngle)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This is the number of degrees the printing will be rotated about the starting location in the counter-clockwise direction. The default value for this parameter is 0 degrees.
        Parameters:
        rotationAngle - Number of degrees to rotate the printing the range of valid values is 0, 90, 180 or 270 degrees.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the parameter values are not in the valid range.
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • setAlignment

        public void setAlignment(ParametersEZ.Alignment alignment)
        This is the horizontal alignment to use when writing the item. The options are:
        • Alignment.Left - Left aligned. This will write the item starting at the column specified in the write command.
        • Alignment.Center - Center aligned. This will write the item centered at the column specified in the write command.
        • Alignment.Right - Right aligned. This will write the item flush against the right side of the column specified in the write command.
        Parameters:
        alignment - Alignment setting to use.
